definition: owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
woven mat/seat/banquet/place in a democratic assembly/classifier for banquets, conversations etc

sentences.english: The whole audience rose as the Chancellor and the Ambassador walked onto the rostrum and took their seats.
sentences.chinese: 全體聽衆起立，彭定康校長和劉大使走上主席臺落座。

sentences.english: Every eye at the conference was focused on the rostrum.
sentences.chinese: 代表們的眼光都集註在大會主席臺上。

sentences.english: The competitors march around the stadium and then form up in the center of the ground facing the tribune.
sentences.chinese: 參賽者繞場一週，然後在場地中央面對主席臺列隊。

sentences.english: The central committee be seat on the platform .
sentences.chinese: 中央委員在主席臺就座。

sentences.english: Platform for private only. Parents please be seated in the spectator area.
sentences.chinese: 主席臺禁止外來人員進入，請家長在兩側觀衆席就坐。

sentences.english: Being bright and brave, the members of the women's volleyball team are passing by the rostrum, walking in vigorous strides.
sentences.chinese: 女排隊員們英姿颯爽，正邁着矯健的步伐通過主席臺。

sentences.english: Amid warm applause the honoured guests mounted the rostrum.
sentences.chinese: 在熱烈的掌聲中貴賓們登上了主席臺。

sentences.english: Then he advanced to the rostrum.

sentences.chinese: 他昂首闊步走上了主席臺。

sentences.english: Or affected the health of wig-wearing chairmen in any way.
sentences.chinese: 還有，他們不會傷害主席臺上那些戴着假髮的人。

sentences.english: Those who sit on the rostrum are somebodies of the school.
sentences.chinese: 坐在主席臺上的那些人都是學校有頭有臉的人物。

sentences.english: Tianjin Binhai New Area Committee Chairman Zhang Celebration seated on the rostrum.
sentences.chinese: 濱海新區政協主席張同慶在主席臺就座。
